summary: random question: on the show, why is sansa called lady of winterfell and not princess since jon is/was kitn? isn't a princess of...
question: random question: on the show, why is sansa called lady of winterfell and not princess since jon is/was kitn? isn't a princess of higher rank than a lady, and usually the sister or daughter of a king?
answer: In the books every Stark sibling except Jon become princes and princesses of Winterfell after Robb is declared king. The show for some reason ignored that so when Jon left for Dragonstone, Sansa became Lady of Winterfell. Had Bran accepted the role he would have become Lord of Winterfell.

reblog.comment: In the books every Stark sibling except Jon become princes and princesses of Winterfell after Robb is declared king. The show for some reason ignored that so when Jon left for Dragonstone, Sansa became Lady of Winterfell. Had Bran accepted the role he would have become Lord of Winterfell.

trail.content_raw: In the books every Stark sibling except Jon become princes and princesses of Winterfell after Robb is declared king. The show for some reason ignored that so when Jon left for Dragonstone, Sansa became Lady of Winterfell. Had Bran accepted the role he would have become Lord of Winterfell.
trail.content: In the books every Stark sibling except Jon become princes and princesses of Winterfell after Robb is declared king. The show for some reason ignored that so when Jon left for Dragonstone, Sansa became Lady of Winterfell. Had Bran accepted the role he would have become Lord of Winterfell.

blog.description:
#Thats not my Dany and Jamie

some of you never had to see your favorite character being ruined by bad and inconsistent writing and it shows

summary:
Everyone will be practicing their sword fighting and what not before the big white walker war, yeah?
So I would literally d i e,...
body:
Everyone will be practicing their sword fighting and what not before the big white walker war, yeah?

So I would literally d i e, if Brienne was practicing with probs Arya or someone, maybe Pod, anyway! Like their sword fighting and then when their done, Jamie comes in going “mind if I cut in?”

And cause he’s all good, he’s normal now, he’s not a weak ass like he was when Brienne defeated him. So they’d both have an actual challenge here!

like I NEED A SMALL CUTE FIGHT WITH THEM BOTH

bonus: with Brienne winning once again.

summary:
“Do you know the first thing about sword fighting?” 
All she could think of was the lesson Jon had given her. “Stick them with...
text:
“Do you know the first thing about sword fighting?”
All she could think of was the lesson Jon had given her. “Stick them with the point end,” she blurted out.

Arya

summary: A Song for Dragons: Chapter 23 - The Knives of Harrenhal
title: A Song for Dragons: Chapter 23 - The Knives of Harrenhal
body:
Read with music

Read on AO3

Preview below the cut

THE TURNCLOAK

He was frozen, and he will be dead. Theon pulled himself out of the water, a thousand freezing knives sliced through his muscles and flesh, and his throat was burned with the cold. Gods, Theon thought he knew what it was like to be cold. He had spent half of his years in Winterfell, but nothing burnt like this.

The Dark Heart was behind him. From here on the frozen shore, it looked at peace. But Theon was there. He knew that on the deck, it was a massacre. The men from Eastwatch were being slaughtered, and all Theon could do was jump, and swim, and die anyway.

His teeth clattered like a hundred beating drums. Theon struggled to his feet, his wet boots sinking into the cold earth. Dead mean, he was a dead man. He was going to freeze, the deed was done, his life was forfeit.

Keep moving, he had to keep moving. The dead were behind him. Dead things in the water. They ripped apart the Dark Heart, and all the other ships too. Theon had to keep running. He would die from the cold, but he would not die from the dead. He won’t let that happen. He couldn’t—

Fire. Fire. He needed to make a fire. No matter how pitiful it would be, no matter how impossible to make a spark, he had to make one. It was his only chance. His hope, his desperate prayer.

He was somewhere beyond the Wall, and wherever her was, it was filled with trees. Towering trees that loomed over him like a giant. Beneath their shade, the stars were missing, and the night sky was gone. Theon was cloaked in their shadows. Before Theon entered the forest, he looked back one last time, shivering, shaking. The dead were not following his steps.

Twigs. He needed to get twigs. Scratch them together, lay clumps of grass beneath them, pray to all the old gods and the new and the foreign and the unknown for a taste of flame. His one hope, his one chance. Theon had never known how weak of a creature that man was but at that desperate moment, when all his life and hopes rested upon the existence of a flickering flame.

The twigs were easy to find; clumps of grass were impossible beneath all the snow. But it seemed half of the forest was made up of pine trees, and Theon found himself clutching fistfuls of pine slipping past his fingers. There was a tree, the bark only half covered in snow, its countless limbs casting a wide and imposing shade. It was there that Theon made his stand.

Theon half-remembered how to survive out in the wilds. It was something that Lord Stark had said to him once. Condense the dry leaves into a pile, rub the sticks together, blow soft, and do it again. And again. And again, until you would see the small finger of smoke trail up. Theon obeyed his memories like it was a desperate prayer. The twigs slipped out of his hands, his fingers shook, and stabs of cold pain echoed across his jaw.

Theon prayed. Do not let me die like this. I don’t want to die. I am not ready to die. The boys of the miller’s wife had begged him too, called him “M’lord” and asked for mercy. Theon didn’t give it to them. Why would the gods heed him? But he prayed all the same.

Only a minute passed him by, or an hour, an eternity, it didn’t matter. Theon could feel the frost on his face. A chill had dug beneath his fingernails, twisting away all of the heat from him. Ice had begun to spread across his lips. Theon rubbed the sticks together, and prayed. He had never been more devout, as he watched his life slip through his frozen fingers. A flicker of a flame. All I ask from you is that. A lick of heat. Warmth. I want to die warm.
body_abstract:
Read with music

Read on AO3
